{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3139613,"name":"Mickey Coenen","username":"Mickey_Coenen","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/bbce88/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-04T18:02:33.862Z","cooked":"

Our team is having a problem with our swerve drive mk4i. We are using thrifty bot analog encoders (so no CANcoders) with neo motors. We modified the swerve template library to be suitable for encoder (change CANcoder factory methods to Analog factory methods). Here’s our modified version.
Our angles are not changing when we rotate the wheels (the 5th in proceeding decimal might change but not the overall angle). Our angles are reading from 0 to 358. We read from shuffleboard and printed to console.

We are returning our absolute angle here: swerve-template/AnalogFactoryBuilder.java at analog-encoder · cdhrobotics/swerve-template · GitHub
“”"
@Override
public double getAbsoluteAngle() {
double absoluteAngle = Math.toRadians(analogEncoder.get());
absoluteAngle %= 2.0 * Math.PI;
if (absoluteAngle < 0.0) {
absoluteAngle += 2.0 * Math.PI;
}
return absoluteAngle;
}
“”"
It appears the change of angle is very low when we rotate the wheels by hand. Were not sure if its a programming issue or mechanical.

Any help would be great, thank you!

@Mickey_Coenen Checking to see if you were able to solve this. We are struggling with the MK4i and the Thrifty Encoders too.

Have you verified that you installed the encoders into the housings so that the sensitive part of the encoder (little rectangle) is directly above the magnet? If so, are you using the new encoder mounts? We were able to get proper readings using the old mounts once we positioned the encoder correctly, but I think the new ones are less prone to error.

Here’s a link to the new mounts if you want to 3d print some: TTB TAE Cases - Google Drive
